body.p:
New York April 28th 1864
To His Excellency the Governor
of the State of Kentucky
Thos. E. Bramlette
Dear Sir,

We the undersigned citizens of the City of New York take pleasure in recommending to your notice Mr. Hiram Black Esqr of this city; and we do respectfully petition and solicit that he may be appointed as "Commissioner for the State of Kentucky". in and for the City and County of New York, for the State of New York

We do hereby certify that Mr. Blake is a practicing Attorney and Notary Public in this City: that he is a man of good character, education and integrity, and in our opinion qualified in every way to perform the duties of said office.
Trusting that our petition may meet your approval we have the honor to remain your most obedient servants.

L E Riggs
10 Wall St
D. E. Weld 77 Cedor St

A. W. Lenney
247 Broadway.
E. C. D.Kittredge
4 Wall St.

Hiram Blake

New York
